djangotailoring.tailoringrequest¶

When djangotailoring needs to communicate with the tailoring engine, it uses TailoringRequest objects. Each object encapsulates a combination of document path and subject data which can send themselves through the tailoring engine to produce tailored output.

Exceptions¶

exception djangotailoring.tailoringrequest.TailoringRequestError¶

A base class for the following exceptions. Can be used to grab any downstream tailoring-request related error.

exception djangotailoring.tailoringrequest.MissingSectionError¶

Raised when a requested section does not exist in the current document.

exception djangotailoring.tailoringrequest.MissingDocumentError¶

Raised when a requested document does not exist on the file system.

Classes¶

class djangotailoring.tailoringrequest.TailoringRequest(self, project, docpath=None, subject=None, source='', render_transforms=None)¶
Parameters:
  • project (a tailoring2 Project instance) – the project used when building a tailoring engine pipeline
  • docpath (a string) – the path (absolute or project-relative) to the document to tailor with
  • subject (a tailoring2 Subject instance) – the subject to tailor on
  • source (a string) – the data source to hoist by default
  • render_transforms (a list of tailoring2.render transform functions) – the list of render transforms to perform on the tailored output
messagedoc¶

The tailoring2 document (an ElementTree) for this tailoring request. Accesses with an undefined docpath will result in None. Accesses for an invalid docpath will raise MissingDocumentError

sections¶

A dictionary of the section names in messagedoc mapped to their associated section ElementTree Elements.

render_section(self, section)¶
Parameters:section (a string) – a section name
Return type:an HTML ElementTree
Returns:the post-render document output of the tailoring engine
Raises :MissingSectionError if no section exists in the document.
